data.title: Careers in Political Science
data.text:
Positive employment news for Political Science students! According to Western's 2020-2021 Graduate Outcomes Report, Political Science students are largely successful in the job market upon graduation. Based on the data within six months of graduation:

Political Science graduates are 77% employed with average earnings of $33,000

Economics/Political Science graduates are 71% employed with average earnings of $30,874

Politics, Philosophy, Economics graduates are 75% employed with average earnings of $35,161

Political Science/Social Studies graduates are 73% employed with average earnings of $27,000

Many of the students not employed were pursuing further education or “other opportunities” (a category that includes those who found employment outside Washington state and whose salaries are not captured in the data).

It’s noteworthy that students who had completed an internship had a 9% greater rate of employment and 20% higher wages earned.

Looking at earnings a few years after graduation, according to 2016 data from PayScale.com median earnings for students with a BA in Political Science were $63,312 at 5-9 years and more than $99,996 at 20+ years. (Source: Study.com)

Here is a list of prospective employers and fields of employment for Political Science graduates. Another useful resource is the Careers in Political Science page of the American Political Science Association website. Students who are interested in learning more about career opportunities in Political Science are also encouraged to visit the Western Career Services Center and sign up for Viking CareerLink, a free online internship and job posting database available to students, alumni, and employers.
